qas.question: When was the Constitution of Bermuda enforced?
Has Bermuda's constitution ever been amended?
What is the head of Bermuda's government referred to as?
What is the legislative branch of Bermuda modeled after?
What does the population get to vote for?

answers.text: The House of Assembly, or lower house

qas.question: What came into force on 7 June 1961?
What is nominated by the governor and appointed by the premier?
What is the upper house called, consisting of 36 members?
What is the lower house called, consisting of 11 members?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The Constitution of Bermuda<b6_0/><b5_0/> came into force on <a0_0>1 June 1967<a0_0/>; <a1_0>it was amended in 1989 and 2003<a1_0/>. The head of government is <a2_0>the premier<a2_0/>. <b7_0>A cabinet<b7_0/> is nominated by the premier and appointed officially by the governor. The legislative branch consists of a bicameral parliament modelled on the <a3_0>Westminster system.<a3_0/> <b8_0>The Senate<b8_0/> is the upper house, consisting of 11 members appointed by the governor on the advice of the premier and the leader of the opposition. <a4_0><b9_0>The House of Assembly<b9_0/>, or lower house<a4_0/>, has 36 members, elected by the eligible voting populace in secret ballot to represent geographically defined constituencies.
